channel.description: Recent content in WordNet on Some Title

item.title: [Machine learning] Use WordNet to mechanically extract similar words
item.description: #Outline of natural language processing Before touching on WordNet, let me briefly touch on natural language processing. In order for a machine to understand sentences in natural language processing, the following morphological analysis, syntactic analysis, semantic analysis, and contextual analysis are required in order. Morphological analysis It is the work of dividing from natural language text data without annotations of information into columns of morphemes (the smallest unit that has meaning in the language) based on information such as the grammar of the target language and the part of speech of words called a dictionary.
